page.title: 08A Guisborough Doctor's a.m.
page.content: Dr Galbraith lives in Belmangate in an old cottage converted from 3 cottages built by Lord Gisborough for his farm labourers. His radio alarm clock wakes him at 7.45 and while getting ready he listens to the news on Radio 4. His wife, Jean,prepares his breakfast of cornflakes,toast,marmalade & coffee. At 8.25 he drives in his VW Polo to the surgery in Westgate, next to the library. He picks up the case notes for this morning's patients, goes to his office & presses the buzzer for the 1st patient. There are the usual round of ailments: one man needs his ears syringing; a woman wants a preg- nancy test; a mother brings her daughter with suspected measles. After each he writes up his notes. Surgery is over at 12.00. From 12 to 1.00 he calls on the house-bound,e.g. a lady just back after a hip operation.
